New Records: Luis Gil pitched six sparkling innings, allowing only one hit and striking out seven.
The Yankees achieved their 12th shutout of the season with a 3-0 victory.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit an RBI double and scored on Austin Wells' two-run single in the third inning.
The game was New York's first at Wrigley Field since 2017.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were on a six-game trip and were trailing the AL East-leading Baltimore team.
The Cubs were in a strong position in the NL wild card race after a successful road trip.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Aaron Boone called the game a good day for the Yankees.
Manager Craig Counsell highlighted the Cubs' struggles in scoring despite Gil's strong performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Rizzo received a warm reception in his return to Wrigley Field.
The Yankees were using a closer-by-committee approach after Clay Holmes' recent performance issues.
Others: Luis Gil, who had been sidelined with a back injury, made a successful return to the mound.
The game's attendance was 40,101, with the first pitch at 6:20 PM.
